sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: An isosceles triangle has two congruent sides of length 7 cm each, and a base that measures 8 cm. Find the length of the remaining side of the triangle.
message_2: Since the triangle is isosceles, the two congruent sides are already given as 7 cm each. The base is given as 8 cm. The remaining side is one of the congruent sides, which is 7 cm.
